This tells us that Toby should finish reading the book approximately 9225 hours and 38 minutes prior to his scheduled departure time. But remember, it still takes 10 minutes for him to travel to the airport. Thus, there should be some extra minutes left until his departure time arrives. In order to calculate these extra minutes, we need to subtract finishingTimeMinutes and travelingTimeMinutes: extraMinutes = departureTimeMinutes - (finishingTimeMinutes + travelingTimeMinutes) = 0 - (554002.83 + 10) = -554012.83 minutes (-9225 hours and 48 minutes). Note that negative numbers don't make sense in this context since they imply that we went back in time. However, what this calculation indicates is that if Toby finishes the book exactly on time, then there won't be any extra minutes for him before his scheduled departure time arrives. In other words, Toby will have zero extra minutes before leaving the airport. The answer is: zero extra minutes.
